result.execSummary:
The defendant Layne Michael Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I will complete 40 hours of community service through the Buffalo-Pepin Criminal Justice Coordinating Council.  Failure to complete community service will be considered a violation of this agreement.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs/surcharges at the rate of $100/month commencing 09-01-2015 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.
5 days in the Pepin County Jail with work release commencing immediately.

records.addlTxt:
Order Re: Remedial Contempt:
Court finds defendant in contempt of court for failure to pay fine, forfeiture or other financial obligations as ordered by the Court.  By reason that contempt the defendant is ordered to serve 12 days in jail consecutive to any other sentence, conditional jail or prejudgment detention.  The defendant may purge contempt by doing the following:  Paying the unpaid court obligations in the amount of $443.00.  If the contempt finding is for unpaid court ordered obligations, serving the jail does not relieve the defendant of those obligations.....

Defendant Layne Michael Johnson in court, in custody.  Court explains why defendant in custody for failure to pay.  Can pay $443 to get out otherwise I remand you to PCJ for period not to exceed period of 10 days with credit for time picked up on warrant.
Letter to defendant advising of seven days to pay or warrant will be issued.

ADDRESS INFO for Layne Michael Johnson
Current: E9176 County Hwy V, New Auburn, WI 54757 United States  (Effective: 07-13-2015)
Prior: 170 Country Lane Apt #5, Durand, WI 54736 United States

Defendant Layne Michael Johnson in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Revoke DPA.  Defendant failed to comply with the community service program.  Court accepts mto DPA, accepts defendant's plea and finds him guilty.  State confirms victim rights complied with, notes 40 hrs. C/S equivalent to 5 days jail.  Court sentences defendant to 5 days in the Pepin County Jail with work release to commence immediately; provide a DNA sample; pay costs/surcharges at rate of $100/mo. com. 9/1/15.  Advised of appeal rights and provided form to complete along with TTP paperwork.
Motion to Revoke Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement.
Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S for failure to comply with the program.  The defendant has not completed the assigned community service.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement filed.

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 40 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 06-06-2015. Complete all hours by 09-01-2015.  Consequences of termination from the program:  Revoke DPA

Judge advises defendant of charge/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, defers acceptance of plea and approves DPA as stated on record.  State to follow-up with written DPA.

Defendant Layne Michael Johnson in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs the court of plea negotiations, DAGPA for 1 year with conditions: no violations of law; 40 hours of community service. Victim present in courtroom.  Defendant files Waiver of Rt. to Atty form with the court.

Defendant Layne Michael Johnson in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $500 Sign. Bond.  Court sets $500 Signature Bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
